meanings.definition: The quality or state of being infusible.
meanings.sent1: The infusibilities of the metal made it impossible to melt.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the infusibilities of various substances in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The infusibilities of the chocolate caused it to remain solid even under heat.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the infusibilities of a diamond.
meanings.sent5: The infusibilities of the rock were so remarkable that it became a topic of discussion among geologists.

meanings.sent1: The tea leaves had great infusibilities, releasing flavor easily in hot water.
meanings.sent2: The chef experimented with different ingredients to test their infusibilities in the dish.
meanings.sent3: The infusibilities of the sponge cake made it absorb the syrup quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had the infusibilities of a sponge, absorbing knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The infusibilities of the fabric allowed the dye to spread evenly, creating a beautiful pattern.
